Title: Shift Lead - Lower Lawrenceville
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DashMart is a local-fulfillment center owned and operated by DoorDash, offering customers fast, reliable, and high quality delivery. Customers order their convenience, grocery, retail, and prepared foods in the DoorDash app, and our team members fulfill orders in a real, brick-and-mortar store, for our Dashers to deliver. Were open early and close late - some sites even run 24/7!
About the Role
DashMart is looking for a motivated and experienced individual that excels in fast-paced, physical environments, and is excited to roll up their sleeves and actively engage in day-to-day operations.  In this role, you will work within a local-fulfillment center supporting Site Management running great shifts and delegating tasks. As a Shift Lead, you will have shift responsibility for fulfilling orders in a warehouse environment, maintaining inventory, and in some locations, this involves preparing food in a light-prep kitchen.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Be an Owner: Take ownership of your assigned shifts including warehouse and kitchen processes, safety/cleanliness, quality, and training. Maintain accountability for inventory, equipment, and other company assets to ensure they are properly handled, stored, and protected from loss or theft.
Delight Customers: Ensure customer orders are delivered with high quality by executing orders accurately, communicating with customers when issues arise, and making sure Dasher pickups go smoothly. 
Lead: Guide Operations Associates through their shift by ensuring the team works safely and productively, and serving as the point of escalation for daily operations.   
One Team One Fight: Support operations in both the warehouse and kitchen, assist with day-to-day tasks, and lead by example.You will be expected to engage in professional and respectful interactions with team members and customers, ensuring a positive and safe atmosphere in the warehouse while providing a high-quality experience for our customers.
Help improve Operations: Contribute ideas to improve our quality and customer experience. 

Were excited about you because...

Youre self-motivated, positive, and a team player. You work well with others, and you bring a great attitude to your work each and every day.  You have high integrity and are excited to delight customers.
You have a proven track record of success in food and beverage, warehouse, and/or retail environments.
Youre able to be on your feet, and move heavy products. You are excited and physically able (with or without accommodation) to lift up to 50 lbs depending on the needs of the specific site and can operate a pallet jack and hand truck.
You have the ability and desire to obtain and maintain a food handling certificate. (DoorDash will provide this training)
You have a high school diploma or GED equivalent. A college diploma is even better but not required. 
You are at least 18 years of age.
You're organized and proficient in Google Docs and Google Sheets.
You have flexibility in your schedule. Depending upon the scheduling needs of the hiring site, you can be available for a number of different shifts a week.

Benefits

Market Competitive pay 
Opportunity for pay increases twice a year based upon performance
Paid time off (PTO) and sick leave
Health benefits starting Day 1 (Medical, Dental, & Vision)
401k match
Gym membership reimbursement (up to $75/month)
Monthly DashPass subscription including access to HBO max and Lyft Discounts
Employee Assistance Program
Career advancement opportunities

The New Verticals team is all about expanding DoorDash beyond Restaurants, and helping deliver anything our Customers want. We are able to do this by identifying efficiencies, building product toolings and launching operational processes at scale. You will own metrics, pull operational & product levers and drive impactful results across our Grocery, Convenience, Alcohol and Retail businesses.
About the Role
We're looking for a Manager to join our New Verticals Strategy & Operations team to build and shape the future of DoorDash with our New Verticals Fulfillment team focused on Inventory Quality.
The Inventory Quality pod is focused on step-changing Customer outcomes through understanding what is in-stock and out-of-stock at every New Verticals store on DoorDash. About the Role
The Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) team is looking for an experienced Risk & Compliance Lead (Individual Contributor role) with banking and/or financial service experience who is smart, fast, and a hard worker to help drive risk management strategy, regulatory, contractual and compliance frameworks (GLBA, PCI DSS, SOC 2, HIPAA, etc.) related to DoorDash financial service and other vertical products.  You will work cross-functionally with a range of teams to manage the compliance readiness program, risk management program including risk identification, gap mitigation, and controls enablement projects. This will be a highly visible and impactful role in which you will be challenged to develop controls, automate processes, and validate adherence to Cybersecurity compliance mandates in a complex and evolving cybersecurity landscape. If you like to work with business partners to understand and creatively address risk, and design controls for cutting edge processes, we want to talk to you!

Contribute in building the GRC team strategy & roadmap in collaboration stakeholders
Assist in rollout and adoption of our governance, risk and compliance tool
Manage the Risk & Compliance program related to DoorDash financial service products
Oversee of the design, implementation and periodic testing of controls in collaboration with security, engineering, IT and other risk functions
Stand up and provide ongoing monitoring of compliance programs to meet regulatory and contractual obligations of DoorDash financial service products, including GLBA, PCI DSS, SOC 2, HIPAA etc.,

Experience managing multiple concurrent projects across functional teams, building sustainable processes
Ability to understand complex system architecture/data flows, what Cybersecurity risks affect a variety of data, applications and infrastructure.
Experience solving systemic issues and potential risks that require creative thinking and solutions
Experience in evaluating business asks taking into consideration risks, controls, and mitigating actions.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills - you are able to translate business requirements into technical solutions

About the Team
Superette is DoorDashs In-House Creative Studio. Our team's role is to build and continuously strengthen a unique and meaningful brand that resonates with our customers and connects with culture. About the Role
Were looking for a Senior Copywriter to help bring our brand voice to life across all social platforms. In this role, youll concept and craft compelling, scroll-stopping copy that cuts through the noise. Youre a natural storyteller whos fluent in the language of the internet, quick to ideate, and collaborative at heart  someone who thrives as a creative partner to channel managers and designers. Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Write with voice and craft across platforms, from scripts and captions to on-screen text for Instagram, TikTok, X, Facebook, and more.
Be a go-to creative partner for the social team  jumping on cultural moments, trends, campaigns, and key milestones to turn them into engaging copy.
Write across formats, from short-form video to memes, in ways that feel platform-native and audience-first.
Be the writing partner who brings scripts to life alongside our motion designer.
Use real consumer behavior and cultural signals to craft resonant and timely stories.
Be a trusted gut check for community and channel managers to ensure voice and tone is consistent across every interaction.
Translate big campaign ideas into social-first content in collaboration with creatives.
Stay ahead of platform updates and algorithm shifts to make sure content gets the reach and performance it deserves. 
Get hands-on when needed, capturing and editing content yourself or occasionally stepping in front of the camera, if you're game.
Consult with Influencer Marketing, providing a POV on scripts or talking points.

Youre quick to spot a moment  and even quicker to turn it into a concept that sticks.
Youre a trendsetter, not a follower, and the first to experiment with new features to keep content fresh and relevant.
Youre sharp, nimble, and can deliver great work without a budget or production  sometimes even editing it yourself.
Youre not a traditional copywriter  you have deep, specialized experience in organic social creative.
Youre strategic, insight-driven, digitally sharp, and come to work every day with new ideas for how content can elevate how we show up for our audience.

About the Team
On the Merchant Strategy & Operations team, our mission is to have best-in-class restaurant selection for Consumers and build a platform that enables the merchant to grow sustainably on Doordash. We work on solving merchant pain points by improving their tooling, solving the foundations like login and store setup, and collaborating cross-functionally for successful go-to-market launches. 
About the Role
As a Senior Associate on DoorDashs Merchant Strategy & Operations (S&O) team, you will own the strategy and success of our Merchant applications (web and mobile), including the foundations of user access and permissions. You will grow adoption and engagement by launching new features, building the product roadmap, uncovering insights in the data and merchant feedback, and testing new ideas for product-market fit. You will solve problems by digging into details, executing quickly in the face of ambiguity, and building strong cross-functional collaboration.

Title: Electrical Engineer  Automation & Functional Design
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DoorDash Labs is an independent team within DoorDash. We are working on building autonomous delivery robots from the ground-up and other automation solutions as part of DoorDash's core delivery platform. If you have a passion for applying AI and robotics solutions in a service used by millions of people, then we want to talk to you!
About the Role
We are seeking an experienced Electrical Engineer to develop and maintain automation frameworks and functional test setups for power and high-speed designs. The ideal candidate will have strong experience in LabVIEW development, power electronics, and high-speed signal testing. This role will focus on automating test processes, analyzing test results, and ensuring product performance meets stringent design specifications.  
You will report to the Lead of our Core Engineering team based in San Francisco. This role is in-office.
You're excited about this opportunity because you will...

Test Automation Development 

Develop, implement, and maintain automated test scripts using LabVIEW for custom power and high-speed designs.  
Create modular and reusable test frameworks to support rapid validation of product performance.  

Functional Testing 

Design and execute functional tests for power electronics and high-speed interfaces (e.g., PCIe, USB, Ethernet).  This requires cross-collaboration with EE design and FW team to understand scope and method of tests to run at EOL.
Develop and configure test instrumentation for power and signal integrity analysis (e.g., oscilloscopes, power analyzers).  
Automate high-speed signal characterization and power cycling tests.  

Data Analysis & Reporting 

Capture, process, and analyze test data to identify trends, failures, and performance bottlenecks.  
Generate test reports with statistical analysis and present findings to cross-functional teams.  

Test Infrastructure & Maintenance 

Design and maintain test benches, fixtures, and automated test equipment (ATE).  
Ensure calibration and traceability of test instrumentation.  
Implement self-diagnostic and health-monitoring routines in automated test setups.  

Process Improvement

Optimize test execution time and resource utilization.  
Develop guidelines and best practices for test automation in power and high-speed domains.  


We're excited about you because... 

Bachelors or Masters degree in Electrical Engineering or related field.  
8+ years of experience with LabVIEW development, test automation, and functional testing.  
Strong background in power electronics and high-speed signal design/testing.  
Hands-on experience with test equipment (oscilloscopes, power supplies, signal analyzers).  
Understanding of signal integrity, power integrity, and EMI/EMC principles.  
Experience with scripting languages (e.g., Python) for data processing and automation.  
Familiarity with PCIe, USB, Ethernet, and other high-speed protocols.

Preferred Qualifications...

Certified LabVIEW Architect (CLAD).
Experience with automotive tier-1 suppliers in setting up automation testing environments.
On-site debugging experience with tier-1 suppliers.
Knowledge of test standards for power and high-speed electronics.

About the Team
DashMart is a local-fulfillment center owned and operated by DoorDash, offering customers fast, reliable, and high quality delivery. Customers order their convenience, grocery, retail, and prepared foods in the DoorDash app, and our team members fulfill orders in a real, brick-and-mortar store, for our Dashers to deliver. Were open early and close late - some sites even run 24/7!
About the Role
DashMart is looking for a motivated individual that excels in fast-paced, physical environments, and is excited to roll up their sleeves and actively engage in day-to-day operations. In this role, your tasks will include:

Inventory receiving and management: Accurately receive and stock inventory, ensuring all products are accounted for and safeguarded against loss or theft. Monitor product quality and freshness and ensure proper product rotation. Follow all HACCP, food-handling and spoilage management processes.
Pick, pack and sort: Use technology similar to smartphone devices to scan packages, pick and stage orders, and conduct handoffs to Dashers.
Delight customers: Communicate clearly and pleasantly with customers through the app when substitution approvals are needed.
Warehouse organization and safety: Maintain a safe working environment by performing all duties in compliance with DashMart safety and security standards. Complete all cleaning and warehouse organization tasks as assigned by management. 
Be a team player: Contribute to a positive working environment by bringing the DoorDash one team, one fight value to life in all you do. Work with the teams goals in mind, sharing ideas, opportunities and challenges where appropriate. Engage in professional and respectful interactions with team members and customers, ensuring a positive and safe atmosphere in the warehouse.
Runner/Dasher coordination [where applicable]: Guide Runners and Dashers to pickup locations. Support parking lot management by directing traffic, collecting racks and carts, and performing other duties as assigned by management.
 Food preparation [where applicable]: Assist in light preparation of hot and/or cold foods and pre-packaging food items for staging and delivery. Willing to learn basic kitchen skills.

Engage in professional and respectful interactions with team members and customers, ensuring a positive and safe atmosphere in the warehouse.
Runner/Dasher coordination [where applicable]: Guide Runners and Dashers to pickup locations. Support parking lot management by directing traffic, collecting racks and carts, and performing other duties as assigned by management.

You're excited about this opportunity because you will...

Operate & Build  Drive the strategy & execution for new DoorDash Selection initiatives to help build and retain a differentiated merchant base

RoleDescription:
About the Team
DoorDashs mission is to grow and empower local economies. By building intelligent, last-mile delivery technology for local cities, DoorDash connects people with the local businesses they care about  helping grow businesses and the communities that support those businesses. To further this mission, were looking for a marketer who will sit at the intersection of growth, brand, product, and operations, to develop integrated marketing strategies for our consumer business at DoorDash. The integrated marketing team is a group of marketing generalists responsible for translating business goals into marketing strategies and serving as the general manager across the organization to bring those strategies to market. 
About the Role
The Consumer Integrated Marketing team is looking for a strategic, entrepreneurial, and data-driven marketer to grow DoorDash's Marketplace. This role will report into the New Customers + Channels Marketing lead, and will own building the strategy, development and execution of highly engaging, innovative strategic partner marketing programs that fuel our Marketplace growth. In this role, youll create and execute integrated marketing programs and campaigns built against both external partner and DoorDash goals. You will work closely with cross functional teams to ensure we are maximizing DoorDash value from our partner relationships, with marketing that drives our business forward and serves our audiences. The ideal candidate is someone who is comfortable operating at highly strategic and tactical levels, keeping a strong pulse on business performance to ensure the cross-functional marketing team has a clear line of sight of how we are pacing to quarterly and annual goals. They have experience building consensus with large cross-functional teams, and excel at tracking and communicating campaign performance while accomplishing marketing and business objectives.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Own and nurture marketing relationships with some of our largest and most high profile strategic partners 
Develop annual co-marketing strategies and plans with key partners and establish buy-in from internal and external stakeholders 
Execute integrated co-marketing campaigns from strategy and concept, through production, implementation, delivery and reporting 
Manage day-to-day operations of partner marketing efforts, including paid media, promotions, emails, in-app experiences, website content, and status meetings
Manage paid media strategies and campaign execution for partners to increase new customer acquisition, and delivery orders in both DoorDash and partner channels 
Create project creative briefs for individual campaign assets, project manage the creation of campaign assets and provide status updates to stakeholders
Use a data-first approach to optimize campaigns against our goals, improve profitability, and drive results

Were excited about you because you have...

Bachelors degree or higher; MBA a plus
5+ years as a Marketer spanning both brand and direct response
Experience in partner marketing at a consumer brand or tech company
Excellent verbal / written communication and presentation skills and are able to organize critical info both to senior leaders, external partners, and cross-functional stakeholders.
Experience sifting through a detailed analysis and synthesizing the key points to make data-driven decisions, while still having a strong bias for action and being able leverage your intuition when you dont have all the data you might need. 
A creative and entrepreneurial mindset - you enjoy tackling unsolved problems, building, and finding creative solutions with limited resources. 
A love for collaborating and working on a team with extensive cross-functional experience partnering with groups across (both internal and external) marketing partners (ie. CRM, paid media, creative, etc), analytics, product, etc.  

Why Youll Love Working at DoorDash because...

We are leaders - Leadership is not limited to our management team. Its something everyone at DoorDash embraces and embodies.
We are doers - We believe the only way to predict the future is to build it. Creating solutions that will lead our company and our industry is what we do -- on every project, every day. 
We are learners - Were not afraid to dig in and uncover the truth, even if its scary or inconvenient. Everyone here is continually learning on the job, no matter if weve been in a role for one year or one minute.
We are customer-obsessed - Our mission is to grow and empower local economies. We are committed to our customers, merchants, and dashers and believe in connecting people with possibility.
We are all DoorDash - The magic of DoorDash is our people, together making our inspiring goals attainable and driving us to greater heights.

As part of the Commerce Platform team, the Senior Associate will have the opportunity to help define, test and scale Commerce Platforms next biggest bets.

As a Senior Associate on our Commerce Platform Growth Strategy & Operations team, you will play a critical role in driving our growth and success. As a direct owner of this segment, you will help us to build and execute on our growth strategy across some of the largest and most strategic clients. This includes helping us launch and scale our partnerships, finding product market fit, building strategic go to market strategies, and partnering cross-functionally to bring solutions forward.
We dream big and bring the newest products to market. On a typical day, you may work with team members to design experiments that improve quality and delivery operations, test the best new marketing strategies,  address issues that enable our and our merchants processes run efficiently, or dive into data to explain performance at the lowest level of detail and make sure we never stop growing. The ideal candidate for this role should be a self-starter with an entrepreneurial mindset, able to take ownership and create plans from scratch, and drive execution while obtaining cross-functional buy-in to achieve DoorDash Commerce Platform's strategic goals.
You will report into a Manager in our Commerce Platform Restaurants team in our Platform Products organization.
Youre Excited About This Opportunity Because You Will ...

Build and own the business  Drive growth and adoption of some of our top priority projects
Business development  Develop and foster deep relationships with top priority merchant partners to iterate and grow the business.  Key Merchant point of contact within the Strategy & Ops team
Go-to-market strategy  Build a strong understanding of product market fit, value proposition, pricing, and the competitive landscape, and help the team develop a go-to-market strategy based on these inputs. Grow a high-potential offering within a high-growth business.
Improve the product  Guide operational improvements for our merchant partners by understanding their needs and working with internal partners to design solutions throughout the product experience. Steer the Commerce Platform product roadmap informed by quantitative analysis and qualitative merchant feedback
Influence  Work cross-functionally with our Product, Engineering, Finance, Analytics, Support, Sales and Account Management teams to drive growth and scale.
Experiment  Evaluate and test various revenue, cost and quality drivers.

Were Excited About You Because...

You have a Bachelors degree or higher
You have 3+ years of experience in consulting, strategy, or operations; high-growth/early-stage startup or entrepreneurial experience is a big plus
Your expert communication and interpersonal skills set you apart
You are a strong analytical thinker who can provide applicable recommendations out of a complex, sometimes murky, dataset
You have a bias towards action and are able to thrive in a fast-paced, constantly changing work environment

You crave responsibility and want to shape the vision and direction of the company 
Youre willing to get your hands dirty and youre open to feedback.
Youre excellent at motivating potential partners to see the benefits DoorDash Commerce Platform will bring to their business

Title: Integrations Onboarding Supervisor
RoleDescription:
About the Team
The Integrations Onboarding Team facilitates seamless experiences connecting our partners across the globe with POS or Inventory Feed system integrations during initial platform launches and transitions to new providers. As part of the Merchant Services Core Onboarding teams, we enable Merchants to reach their revenue goals faster  acting as their technical consultant, we troubleshoot issues with precision and empathy. With adept communication skills and a #one-team-one-fight work ethic, we liaise with internal stakeholders in S&O, Product, BTA/BizApps, and external provider partners in the Restaurant + New Verticals line of business, delivering efficient, quality-driven, and human onboarding experiences.
About the Role
As an Integrations Onboarding Supervisor, you will guide and support your team to provide every merchant a best-in-class integration experience during their journey with DoorDash. You will work closely with our S&O, Engineering, Product, and Onboarding teams to proactively identify ways to improve the merchant experience across every surface that we touch. As a people leader on the IO team, you will be responsible for coaching and developing a team of 20-25 team members ranging from Tech Specialists to Associate Supervisors that provide empathetic and personalized merchant experiences, fostering a customer-obsessed mentality. This includes performing root cause analysis of a diverse range of issues impacting merchant experience and team efficiency, resolving time-sensitive merchant escalations, and identifying ways to continue leveling up. This role is expected to be hybrid and is required to be in the office at least every Thursday in 2025. The core working hours are Monday through Friday 8 am - 5 pm MST. Availability to be on call during nights and weekends is needed to accommodate business needs.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Foster a creative and customer-obsessed mindset across the team to resolve nuanced integration issues for merchants.
Be the CEO of your team; hold bi-weekly 1:1s to review performance, hold monthly career conversations, as well as provide actionable feedback & coaching.
Build a bench of strong performers across Technical Specialists and Associate Supervisor levels.
Work cross functionally to improve POS merchant experience and onboarding processes.
Build scalable processes throughout new applications of the Point of Sale product on our platform.
Become an expert on your line of business and provide tailored insight into your business to diverse audiences. 
Resolve high-visibility escalations by getting in the trenches and troubleshooting a store, jumping on a call with merchants/brands/providers; always keeping the merchant experience at the forefront.

Were excited about you because...

You have demonstrated a commitment to building strong team cultures where making room at the table is paramount.
You enjoy diagnosing issues and developing creative approaches to solving challenges.
You thrive in a fast-paced, demanding environment.
You are detail-oriented and organized - you are able to organize content in a way that is easily digestible by a wide variety of audiences.
You are good at prioritizing competing priorities and delegating work to your team members.
You work well in diverse team environments and elevate your teams voices across different initiatives.
You love helping others achieve their goals and challenge them to become 1% better every day.
You have +2 years of experience leading people.
You have +2 years of experience working with Excel/Google Sheets.
You have +2 years of experience working with Salesforce.
You are comfortable with SQL and tools such as Mode/Sigma/Tableau/Scalyr.
You have experience managing projects with tools like Jira.
You are comfortable using AI in your day-to-day tasks.

Title: DashMart Team Member - 11 Mile & Gratiot
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DashMart is a local-fulfillment center owned and operated by DoorDash, offering customers fast, reliable, and high quality delivery. Customers order their convenience, grocery, retail, and prepared foods in the DoorDash app, and our team members fulfill orders in a real, brick-and-mortar store, for our Dashers to deliver. Were open early and close late - some sites even run 24/7!
About the Role
DashMart is looking for a motivated individual that excels in fast-paced, physical environments, and is excited to roll up their sleeves and actively engage in day-to-day operations. In this role, your tasks will include:

Inventory receiving and management: Accurately receive and stock inventory, ensuring all products are accounted for and safeguarded against loss or theft. Monitor product quality and freshness and ensure proper product rotation. Follow all HACCP, food-handling and spoilage management processes.
Pick, pack and sort: Use technology similar to smartphone devices to scan packages, pick and stage orders, and conduct handoffs to Dashers.
Delight customers: Communicate clearly and pleasantly with customers through the app when substitution approvals are needed.
Warehouse organization and safety: Maintain a safe working environment by performing all duties in compliance with DashMart safety and security standards. Complete all cleaning and warehouse organization tasks as assigned by management. 
Be a team player: Contribute to a positive working environment by bringing the DoorDash one team, one fight value to life in all you do. Work with the teams goals in mind, sharing ideas, opportunities and challenges where appropriate. Engage in professional and respectful interactions with team members and customers, ensuring a positive and safe atmosphere in the warehouse.
Runner/Dasher coordination [where applicable]: Guide Runners and Dashers to pickup locations. Support parking lot management by directing traffic, collecting racks and carts, and performing other duties as assigned by management.
 Food preparation [where applicable]: Assist in light preparation of hot and/or cold foods and pre-packaging food items for staging and delivery. Willing to learn basic kitchen skills.

Youre excited about this opportunity because...

Market Competitive pay (10pm-6am will receive a $2 increase in pay)
AM/PM/Overnight shifts available
Opportunity for pay increases twice a year based upon performance
Paid time off (PTO) and sick leave
Health benefits starting Day 1 for full-time employees (Medical, Dental, & Vision)
Gym membership reimbursement (up to $75/month)
Monthly DashPass subscription (including access to HBO Max and Lyft discounts for full-time employees)
Employee Assistance Program
Career advancement opportunities

We're excited about you because...

You have great communication skills, willing to learn, and are a problem solver 
You thrive within a team environment and enjoy a variety of duties
You have experience within retail, customer service, food and beverage, administrative, healthcare or similar industries where you perform a variety of tasks
You have customer facing experience and love to delight customers
Youre able to be on your feet and handle warehouse duties including lifting up to 50 pounds (depending on site requirements) with or without accommodations. 
You have a minimum of a High school diploma or GED equivalent and are 18 years of age or older.

About the Team
As DoorDash continues to grow and expand internationally, its an exciting time to join our Technical Accounting and Financial Reporting team. Our team oversees DoorDashs external  and internal reporting on a company-wide level. We are also the go-to group for technical accounting assessments for significant and unusual transactions, including compliance with U.S. GAAP, internal policies, SOX controls and external audits. Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Manage and prepare quarterly and annual SEC filings, including 10-Qs, 10-Ks and Earnings Releases
Prepare monthly and quarterly consolidated statements of cash flows under US GAAP

Key decision maker on application of and continuous development of accounting policies and standard operating procedures
Partner closely with FP&A, Accounting, Investor Relations and Legal teams on various internal and external reporting projects
This role reports both to the Senior Manager and Director of Technical Accounting and Financial Reporting

Were excited about you because...

Self-motivated and self-managed - able to think independently, creatively, and opportunistically
Get-it-done mindset - you're able to handle stress well, humble and scrappy!
Sharp business acumen and process-oriented 
Data-obsessed and unafraid to go down to the lowest level of detail for truth
Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills
Strong organizational and time management skills
5+ years of accounting experience, with experience in relevant industry public company and/or big 4 public accounting preferred
Bachelor's degree in Accounting, CPA required
Strong knowledge of US GAAP, PCAOB standards, SOX/internal controls
Experience with Oracle, NetSuite and GSuite preferred

RoleDescription:
About the Team
DoorDash is building a multi-category business. In addition to Restaurant, Grocery, and Conveience stores, DoorDash partners with merchants to offer selection across an expanding set of categories, including Beauty, Pet, Sporting Goods, Home Improvement, Electronics, Shoes, and more. We are looking for an Analytics leader to drive our strategy and execution as we accelerate the Retail business.
About the Role
As the Senior Manager, Data Science, Analytics, youll be leading a team of data scientists who are working on Retail within the New Verticals team. You will develop strategic insights and work closely with the product, engineering, strategy and operations teams to actively build and measure the impact of new features. You will oversee our metrics and analytics roadmap to inform strategic direction for the Retail business, and identify product opportunities. You will also provide technical leadership, build processes, tools, and frameworks to increase velocity and rigor, and partner with data and product engineers to build robust data foundations. 
You're excited about this opportunity because you will...

Lead and develop a team of Data Scientists in investigating complex issues and uncovering key drivers of our business, along with your own contributions as an Individual Contributor
Influence the Product and Operations roadmap by making actionable recommendations based on data
Interface frequently with senior leadership to showcase your teams work and tackle complex business problems
Drive measurement strategy for the area under scope, defining success metrics and implementing best practices around experiment design and statistical analysis
Develop a strategic learning roadmap based on data observations, strategic questions, and hypotheses

We're excited about you because you have...

A degree in Math, Physics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a similar domain
Experience managing a team of data scientists, and a track record of delivering impactful analyses
8+ years of experience in Data Science and Product Analytics, primarily in related industries
3+ years of experience as a people manager
Strength in leading through your technical chops, and ability to leverage it appropriate in the business context
Deep understanding of, and hands-on experience with experimentation
Experience with data pipelines
Excellent communication and cross-functional working skills, including the ability to present complex findings to non-technical audiences and influence strategic decisions

Title: Shift Lead - Crestwood
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DashMart is a local-fulfillment center owned and operated by DoorDash, offering customers fast, reliable, and high quality delivery. Customers order their convenience, grocery, retail, and prepared foods in the DoorDash app, and our team members fulfill orders in a real, brick-and-mortar store, for our Dashers to deliver. Were open early and close late - some sites even run 24/7!
About the Role
DashMart is looking for a motivated and experienced individual that excels in fast-paced, physical environments, and is excited to roll up their sleeves and actively engage in day-to-day operations.  In this role, you will work within a local-fulfillment center supporting Site Management running great shifts and delegating tasks. As a Shift Lead, you will have shift responsibility for fulfilling orders in a warehouse environment, maintaining inventory, and in some locations, this involves preparing food in a light-prep kitchen.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Be an Owner: Take ownership of your assigned shifts including warehouse and kitchen processes, safety/cleanliness, quality, and training. Maintain accountability for inventory, equipment, and other company assets to ensure they are properly handled, stored, and protected from loss or theft.
Delight Customers: Ensure customer orders are delivered with high quality by executing orders accurately, communicating with customers when issues arise, and making sure Dasher pickups go smoothly. 
Lead: Guide Operations Associates through their shift by ensuring the team works safely and productively, and serving as the point of escalation for daily operations.   
One Team One Fight: Support operations in both the warehouse and kitchen, assist with day-to-day tasks, and lead by example.You will be expected to engage in professional and respectful interactions with team members and customers, ensuring a positive and safe atmosphere in the warehouse while providing a high-quality experience for our customers.
Help improve Operations: Contribute ideas to improve our quality and customer experience. 

Were excited about you because...

Youre self-motivated, positive, and a team player. You work well with others, and you bring a great attitude to your work each and every day.  You have high integrity and are excited to delight customers.
You have a proven track record of success in food and beverage, warehouse, and/or retail environments.
Youre able to be on your feet, and move heavy products. You are excited and physically able (with or without accommodation) to lift up to 50 lbs depending on the needs of the specific site and can operate a pallet jack and hand truck.
You have the ability and desire to obtain and maintain a food handling certificate. (DoorDash will provide this training)
You have a high school diploma or GED equivalent. A college diploma is even better but not required. 
You are at least 18 years of age.
You're organized and proficient in Google Docs and Google Sheets.
You have flexibility in your schedule. Depending upon the scheduling needs of the hiring site, you can be available for a number of different shifts a week.

Benefits

Market Competitive pay 
Opportunity for pay increases twice a year based upon performance
Paid time off (PTO) and sick leave
Health benefits starting Day 1 (Medical, Dental, & Vision)
401k match
Gym membership reimbursement (up to $75/month)
Monthly DashPass subscription including access to HBO max and Lyft Discounts
Employee Assistance Program
Career advancement opportunities
